title: Student and Staff Computing Devices
bid_submission_type: Online via iSupplier portal or manual hard copy submission
term_of_bid: 3 years, with two 1-year renewals (total 5 years maximum)
pre_bid_meeting: June 10, 2024, 2:00 PM CST via TEAMS video conference
installation: White glove services including asset decaling, asset reporting, etching, and delivery to varied locations
additional_documentation_required: Factory-authorized repair and maintenance certifications (if reseller)
Certificate of insurance/bond (within 10 days of award)
contract_or_cooperative_to_use: Educational Purchasing Cooperative of North Texas (EPCNT)
bid_summary: Dallas ISD is soliciting proposals for student and staff computing devices, including laptops, desktops, tablets, and display monitors. The resulting contract will be for an initial 3-year term with two 1-year renewal options, not exceeding 5 years total. Vendors can bid on one or multiple device categories, and the District may award to single or multiple vendors. Key requirements include white glove deployment services (asset decaling, reporting, etching, multi-location delivery), adherence to minimum hardware specifications for various device tiers, and provisions for warranty, technical support, and inventory tracking. Submissions are preferred online via the iSupplier portal, but manual hard copies are accepted.
product_specification: Minimum hardware requirements for student devices include Tier 1 & 2 Chromebooks (Celeron N100, 8GB RAM, 11.6-14" display, 64-128GB storage), Tier 3 Windows Laptops (i5 13th Gen, 16GB RAM, 13" display, 256GB SSD), and Tablets (A13 processor, 10.2" Retina, 64GB storage). Staff devices include Tier 1 & 2 Desktops (i5/i7 14th Gen, 16-32GB RAM, 23.8" touch display, 512GB-1TB SSD) and Laptops (i5/i7 14th Gen, 16-32GB RAM, 13" display, 512GB-1TB SSD). Both touch and non-touch display monitors (min 24", 1920x1080) are also specified. All devices must be Enterprise Management Ready and meet specific wireless, port, battery life, and warranty (1-3 years) requirements.
